channel.title: Awards on Jeremiah Jones
channel.description: Recent content in Awards on Jeremiah Jones

item.title: Updates for March
item.description: There’s been a lot going on recently! In September of 2021, I was honored to win the William Jackson Hall Fellowship Award! This Fellowship awarded funding for this semester, so that I’ve been able to focus on my research interests. Specifically, I’m currently using this funding to work on projects related to the issues of high-dimensionality, selection, and inference in personalized medicine. Look for a preprint related to this! Also at the end of last year, I submitted an early version of my paper Casual Mediation Analysis: Selection with Asymptotically Valid Inference, to the ENAR 2022 Distinguished Student Paper Award competition.
